data.title: Get Pricing And Availability
data.meta_description: Booking Nancy Gibbs is simple with Gotham Artists. No more hurdles, just straightforward answers from our friendly team. Book Today.
data.text:
Katty Kay

U.S. Special Correspondent for BBC Studios, Award-Winning Journalist & Best-Selling Author

Katty Kay is an award-winning journalist and news anchor who brings an instinctively global perspective to her observations on American politics and global affairs. During her nearly 30 years with BBC News, she was a reporter and then news anchor, bringing important news from America and around the world to a huge global audience. From her studio in Washington, D.C. Katty has reported on six U.S. presidential elections, national and global politics, and is a passionate women's rights advocate.

Anderson Cooper

Anchor of CNN's Anderson Cooper 360° | Correspondent for CBS's *60 Minutes* | Emmy Award-Winning Journalist | Bestselling Author on Global Issues and Personal Resilience

As the anchor of the Emmy-winning CNN news program Anderson Cooper 360°, he brings the most pressing stories of the day to a worldwide audience from multiple perspectives. In addition to his role as a correspondent for CBS News’ 60 Minutes, Anderson is widely respected for his on-the-scene reporting of breaking news events at home and abroad. Through election cycles, he has become a highly-sought debate moderator, praised for his assertive fact-checking of 2016’s presidential candidates.

Bret Baier

Chief Political Anchor at Fox News | Anchor of "Special Report with Bret Baier" | Bestselling Author | Expert on Politics, Leadership, & Current Events

Bret Baier is a prominent journalist in the news and broadcast industry. Known for his objective reporting, Baier currently serves as FOX News Channel’s (FNC) Chief Political Anchor and Anchor of Special Report with Bret Baier, the top-rated cable news program in its timeslot and consistently one of the top five shows in cable news. Baier celebrated his 10-year anniversary of anchoring Special Report in January 2019. He is also an accomplished author with five New York Times best-sellers and attributes the Catholic church as a major part of his upbringing.

Kara Brown

Pop-Culture Writer & Podcaster

Kara is a writer and former cohost of Crooked Media's pop culture podcast, "Keep It". Television credits include In the Dark and Freeform's grown-ish. Previously she was a senior writer at Jezebel, covering pop culture, race, television and more. She has also contributed to Glamour, Time Magazine, Nylon, Billboard and The Fader. In 2018, she was featured on Forbes Magazine's 30 Under 30 in Hollywood and Entertainment. She is currently developing a new culture podcast with Crooked Media and directing a pilot for NBC with Rashida Jones and Jada Pinkett Smith.

Shereen Marisol Meraji

Founder of NPR's Code Switch, Journalist, Educator

Shereen Marisol Meraji grew up in a Puerto Rican and Iranian home where no one spoke in hushed tones, and where the rhythms and cadences of life inspired her story pitches and storytelling style. As a young producer, Shereen found herself in the midst of a wave of demographic changes that she was poised to report on. Today, she’s an award-winning journalist and co-founder of the pre-eminent podcast about race and identity in America, NPR’s Code Switch: the only podcast about race that's talking about all of us: our histories, how we're represented, the ways we work together and against each other.

Rick Steves

Leading Authority On European Travel

Rick Steves is a popular public television host, a best-selling guidebook author, and an outspoken activist who encourages Americans to broaden their perspectives through travel. He is the founder and owner of Rick Steves' Europe, a travel business with a tour program that brings more than 30,000 people to Europe annually. Rick lives and works in his hometown of Edmonds, Washington, where his office window overlooks his old junior high school.

Gene Demby

Co-host/Correspondent, Code Switch

Gene Demby is a founding member of NPR’s race, ethnicity and culture team, Code Switch. He serves as the blog's "host," starting and moderating conversations across an array of platforms. Before NPR, he served as the managing editor for Huffington Post's BlackVoices following its launch. He later covered politics. Prior to that role he spent six years in various positions at The New York Times. While at NYT, he started a blog about race, culture, politics and media called PostBourgie in 2007.

Maria Ressa

CEO of Rappler, Journalist, Author, Freedom Advocate and 2021 Nobel Peace Prize Winner

Maria’s courage and work on disinformation and ‘fake news’ culminated in being awarded the 2021 Nobel Peace Prize in recognition of her “efforts to safeguard freedom of expression, which is a precondition for democracy and lasting peace.” Her numerous awards include being named Time’s 2018 Person of the Year and listed among its 100 Most Influential People of 2019. Maria advises organizations and corporations on corporate governance, values, and strategy. Her experience as a journalist and an entrepreneur in the digital world makes her a sought-after keynote speaker and panelist.

Katie Couric

Emmy Award-Winning Journalist | Founder of Katie Couric Media | Bestselling Author | Advocate for Cancer Awareness & Women's Empowerment

An Emmy Award-winning journalist, Katie Couric founded Katie Couric Media. Best known for her groundbreaking work as the first solo female anchor of CBS Evening News and longtime co-anchor of NBC's Today Show, she is also a New York Times bestselling author. Having tragically lost her first husband to colorectal cancer, Couric has been committed to publicizing the importance of early screening for cancer. Katie's media company is structured around the significant social issues of our time: gender equality and mental health, producing impactful content. Her memoir, "Going There," is an intimate look at an impactful career and personal life.

Shankar Vedantam

Host of NPR's Hidden Brain Podcast | Author of "The Hidden Brain" | Expert on Unconscious Bias and Human Behavior | Influential Speaker on Psychology and Social Science

Shankar Vedantam is widely regarded as one of the best social science journalists in America. Fascinated by the darkest corners of our human minds and the secrets it keeps from us, he studies the latest discoveries in neuroscience, psychology, and behavioral science to better understand the paradoxes of human behavior. Vedantam was a science correspondent for National Public Radio, where he now hosts the ‘Hidden Brain’ podcast, a brainchild of his New York Times bestseller. Eloquent and witty, Vedantam is highly sought-after for topics on driving change, understanding unconscious biasness, the risk of fear and the science of excellence.

Ezra Klein

Columnist for The New York Times | Host of “The Ezra Klein Show” | Author of “Why We’re Polarized” | Expert on Political Polarization and Media Analysis

Using his trademark depth of policy knowledge and academic research, Ezra Klein gives audiences a systematic look at why American politics is so polarized, and what that polarization has done to electoral institutions, policymaking, and the media. Ezra is the founder of Vox and was formerly an editor-at-large. Before that, he was columnist and editor at the Washington Post, a policy analyst at MSNBC, and a contributor to Bloomberg. Currently, Ezra is a columnist on the New York Times opinion page, host of the award-winning “Ezra Klein Show” podcast, and author of the bestselling book, “Why We’re Polarized.”

Jessica Yellin

Founder of News Not Noise | Emmy and Gracie Award-Winning Journalist | Expert on Media, Politics, and Women’s Leadership

Jessica Yellin is the founder of News Not Noise, an independent digital media brand dedicated to delivering news without inducing panic. She is an Emmy and Gracie award-winning journalist, known for her tenure as Chief White House Correspondent for CNN. Jessica has interviewed numerous high-profile figures, including Presidents Obama, Clinton, and Bush, and continues to be a prominent voice in political reporting and women's leadership.

Yonit Levi

Anchor, Israel's Leading News Program | International Correspondent | Acclaimed Journalist Interviewing World Leaders | Expert on Media and Global Affairs

Yonit Levi is one of the most eminent Israeli television presenters and journalists. The face of Channel 12, hosting its flagship news edition during primetime, Yonit Levi was the first woman in Israel who anchored an evening news edition by herself. In her career, she held extensive interviews with world leaders such as Barack Obama and Bill Clinton and covered critical international events.
